intro: Notopleura crassa, commonly known as the broad-leaved hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Notopleura crassa typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine in some cultures.
